events.event_description: U.S. begins exporting ethane via pipeline to petrochemical plants in Canada, marking the start of U.S. ethane exports.
events.citation: The United States started exporting ethane in 2014 via pipeline to petrochemical plants in Canada.

events.event_description: U.S. expands ethane exports to Europe with the start of marine export terminal operations.
events.citation: In 2016, the United States began exporting ethane to countries in Europe from marine export terminals.

events.event_description: China's Satellite Petrochemical begins ethylene production at two new ethane crackers, increasing domestic ethane demand in China.
events.citation: China's Satellite Petrochemical has begun ethylene production at two new ethane crackers since 2021, which has increased domestic ethane demand in China.

events.event_description: U.S. ethane and ethane-based petrochemical exports reach all-time high of 21.6 million metric tons, up 17% from previous year.
events.citation: U.S. exports of ethane and ethane-based petrochemicals reached an all-time high of 21.6 million metric tons (MMmt) in 2023, up 134% since the United States began exporting ethane in 2014 and 17% more than in 2022

events.event_description: U.S. ethylene exports to Asia grow 77% while exports to Europe fall by more than 50% amid weak macroeconomic environment.
events.citation: In general, ethylene exports to Asia grew 77% from 2022 to 2023, while exports to Europe fell by more than 50% during the same period amid a weak macroeconomic environment.

events.event_description: Total U.S. ethylene-derivative exports grow 20% to 16.9 MMmt, led by 69% increase in exports to Asia.
events.citation: Total U.S. ethylene-derivative exports grew 20% to 16.9 MMmt from 2022 to 2023, led by a 69% increase (2.2 MMmt) in exports to Asia.
